title: How to Change Word to Txt

steps.title: Double-click your Word document to open it in Word.
steps.content: Double-click your Word document to open it in Word. Alternatively, you can open it in any application that supports Word docs, including Corel WordPerfect or OpenOffice.

steps.title: You'll see the File menu at the top-left corner.
steps.content: You'll see the File menu at the top-left corner. On some versions of Word, it will be a big round button with four colored boxes.

steps.title: This tells the application to create a new document.
steps.content: This tells the application to create a new document. If another menu opens before you get a chance to enter a file name, click text document , .txt , or similar.

steps.title: Type a new name for your file.
steps.content: Type a new name for your file. It can have the same name as your old document, as you'll be giving it a different file extension.

steps.title: Select a plain text file type under the document name box.
steps.content: Select a plain text file type under the document name box. Choose .txt , text , plain text , ASCII , UNICODE , or similar, and then click Save .
